com.echsylon.atlantis

Class HeaderManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.echsylon.atlantis.HeaderManager

  • public class HeaderManager
extends Object
    This class is responsible for keeping track of any header key/value pairs. It gives convenience hints on certain expected behavior based on which headers are present in the current collection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HeaderManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<String> get(String key)
      Returns all header values for a given key.
      List<String> getAllAsList()
      Returns an immutable list with all header keys and values.
      Map<String,String> getAllAsMap()
      Returns an immutable map with all header values for all header keys.
      Map<String,List<String>> getAllAsMultiMap()
      Returns an immutable multi-map with all header values for all header keys.
      String getMostRecent(String key)
      Returns the most recently added header value for the given key.
      boolean isExpectedToBeChunked()
      Returns a boolean flag indicating whether there is a "Transfer-Encoding" header with a "chunked" value.
      boolean isExpectedToContinue()
      Returns a boolean flag indicating whether there is an "Expect" header with a "100-continue" value.
      boolean isExpectedToHaveBody()
      Returns a boolean flag indicating whether there is a "Content-Length" header with a value greater than 0.
      int keyCount()
      Returns the number of unique header keys managed by this header manager.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HeaderManager

        public HeaderManager()

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public List<String> get(String key)
        Returns all header values for a given key.
        Parameters:
        key - The header key.
        Returns:
        All corresponding header values in an unmodifiable list, or an empty list if no values could be found for the given key. Never null.

      • getMostRecent

        public String getMostRecent(String key)
        Returns the most recently added header value for the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - The header key.
        Returns:
        The last added corresponding header value, or null if no value could be found for the given key.

      • getAllAsMap

        public Map<String,String> getAllAsMap()
        Returns an immutable map with all header values for all header keys. If there are multiple values for a key, these values are merged, separated by a comma, all according to RFC-2616 Section 4.2 "Message Headers".
        Returns:
        All added header keys and values or an empty map if no headers have been added yet.

      • getAllAsMultiMap

        public Map<String,List<String>> getAllAsMultiMap()
        Returns an immutable multi-map with all header values for all header keys.
        Returns:
        All added header keys and values or an empty map if no headers have been added yet.

      • getAllAsList

        public List<String> getAllAsList()
        Returns an immutable list with all header keys and values. Even list indices should hold a key and odd list indices should hold a value.
        Returns:
        All added header keys and values or an empty list if no headers have been added yet.

      • keyCount

        public int keyCount()
        Returns the number of unique header keys managed by this header manager.
        Returns:
        The number of added keys.

      • isExpectedToHaveBody

        public boolean isExpectedToHaveBody()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether there is a "Content-Length" header with a value greater than 0.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if there is a "Content-Length" header and a corresponding value greater than 0, false otherwise.

      • isExpectedToContinue

        public boolean isExpectedToContinue()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether there is an "Expect" header with a "100-continue" value.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if there is an "Expect" header and a corresponding "100-Continue" value, false otherwise.

      • isExpectedToBeChunked

        public boolean isExpectedToBeChunked()
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether there is a "Transfer-Encoding" header with a "chunked" value.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if there is a "Transfer-Encoding" header and a corresponding "chunked" value, false otherwise.
